The school's English name is '''Mabie Memorial School'''. ==History== It traces its roots to ''The Baptist Theological Seminary of Yokohama'' established by [[Albert Arnold Bennett]], a missionary of the [[American Baptist Churches|American Baptist]] Missionary Union, in 1884. The school's name was changed to '''Kanto Gakuin''' in 1919. ==Organization== Bachelors, master's, and doctoral programs are offered through the College of Humanities, the College of Economics, the College of Law, the College of Engineering. Bachelors programs are offered through the College of Human and Environmental Studies. J.D.
